direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods set error-related fields with similar validation logic and exception handling.
Both methods involve setting error codes, though setErrorCode combines class and number.
Both methods handle error codes and provide corresponding error messages or classifications.
Both methods involve preparing error data for external representation or storage.
Both methods modify the internal state of the object based on error-related data.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require setting error-related fields, which can be used to initialize test cases.
setErrorCode can be invoked before setErrorClass to set up the error code context.
The result of getErrorClass can be used to verify the correctness of setErrorClass.
The reason phrase can be used to verify the error context set by setErrorClass.
